abstract: Who’s first on Google’s Adwords and the Communist sportswriter who pushed for Jackie Robinson.
snippet: Who’s first on Google’s Adwords and the Communist sportswriter who pushed for Jackie Robinson.
lead_paragraph: For all the change whirling about the entertainment business (technological and other), the Oscar nominations announced Tuesday morning send an incongruous message: nothing has changed. Parsing the nine best picture nominees, Michael Cieply finds some recurring patterns: no animation (though, with “Hugo,” a 3-D movie was included); all but one from a major studio or a specialty division of same (“The Artist” is the exception); the settings are more past than present. He continues:

headline.main: The Breakfast Meeting: Same Old Oscars, and Who’s Missing at Davos?
